data.description: At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections,  where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.The Position2026 Summer Intern - Finance Insights and Data Analyst (Tucson)Department SummaryOur framework describes the unique ways Finance can contribute to patients - as an entrepreneur, an owner of end-to-end-processes, a guardian for Finance stakeholders, and a subject matter expert in Finance:Connecting the dots as entrepreneurs: By using our enterprise-wide view, we can drive strategy, innovation, efficiencies, and the best possible allocation of resources. Acting as an entrepreneur essentially means balancing expected risks and benefits by leveraging our deep Finance expertise, balancing exerting caution with taking smart risks, being resilient, and ensuring financial sustainability. Like entrepreneurs, we should stay curious, own the business, and focus on impact.Owning processes and systems end-to-end: With an in-depth understanding of the entire value chain, we are ideally positioned to lead process harmonization, simplification, and standardization across core business processes.Serving as guardians for our stakeholders: By providing transparency and compliance, we can enable business opportunities, safeguard Roche’s assets, and protect the company’s right to operate.Providing specialist expertise: Underpinning everything is the ongoing mastery of the basics of FinanceThis position is based in Tucson, AZ, On-Site.The OpportunityAssist in financial analysis and forecasting in expense, headcount, inventory and capital expenditure to support strategic decision-making processes.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather financial data and provide insights for budgeting and planning purposes.Conduct research on market trends, industry competitors, and emerging opportunities to support financial analysis.Assist in the preparation of financial reports, presentations, and documentation.Contribute to the optimization of financial processes and systems.Collaborate with senior finance professionals to learn and apply financial principles and best practices.Support ad-hoc finance projects as assigned, providing valuable contributions to the team.Program Highlights Intensive 12-weeks, full-time (40 hours per week) paid internship.Program start dates are in May/JuneA stipend, based on location, will be provided to help alleviate costs associated with the internship. Ownership of challenging and impactful business-critical projects.Work with some of the most talented people in the biotechnology industry. Who You Are (Requirements) Required Education: You meet one of the following criteria:Must be pursuing a Bachelor's Degree (enrolled student / completed at least 2 years of college/university).Required majors: Finance, Accounting, Business, or Economics.Required Skills:Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an attention to detail.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial software applications.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.Growth-minded, curious learner that finds accomplishment in dealing with reduction of complexity, simplification and unexplored pathsComplements our culture and the standards that guide our daily behavior & decisions: Integrity, Courage, and Passion.Relocation benefits are not available for this job posting. The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of  Tucson, AZ is $21- $26/hour.  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. This position also qualifies for paid holiday time off benefits.  Who we areA healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.Let’s build a healthier future, together.Roche is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy and practice to employ, promote, and otherwise treat any and all employees and applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence. The company's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination, including but not limited to, discrimination on the basis of Protected Veteran status, individuals with disabilities status, and consistent with all federal, state, or local laws.If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form Accommodations for Applicants.
